vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
εἰσκυκλ-έω,
wheel in, especially in a theatre, turn a thing inwards by machinery, and so, withdraw it from the eyes of the spectators, [Refs 5th c.BC+] some spirit has wheeled ill luck into the house, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, plunge into, τοῖς τῆς ἱστορίας διηγήμασι [LXX]middle, with accusative, [ἡρῷ᾽ ἔπη].. εἰσκυκλήσομαι poetical in [Refs]
__II εἰσκυκλήσας· περιελθών, [Refs 5th c.AD+]
